text:
Went there to celebrate Mother's Day. To my surprise, their service is fantastic. Even gave my mom flowers as mother's day gift.

Food pricing is definitely reasonable.
Food taste really good.
Highly recommend for family to try their zichar there.

There’s a store with an old uncle selling traditional Hokkien Mee, carrot cake, and char kway teow. It reminds me of the food that I used to eat with my grandparents. The portions are really huge! Food is delicious

Frequently came here to dine...here they offer a  good variety of food  , the herbal clayport is the best here  , price are very cheap...also selling western food  , Thai food, fish porridge,,chye png ( economic veg rice )  and seafood  ...price at this stall is quite reasonable  , like best here is the service  by the drink stall....

Second-hand smoke pervades almost the entire place!! We were breathing smoke most of the time, despite sitting as far away as possible. When we first sat down in the non-smoking area, one of the stall attendants even sat down beside us with a lit cigarette. Fortunately, he was decent enough to move away when I requested him not to smoke there. The place indeed looks clean otherwise. Food wise, we had the economical rice and it was very normal. I’m sure the other stalls might have more interesting offerings.

This coffee shop has NO weakest link. From the fish soup to the claypot chicken to the Caifan, to Laksa and Lor Mee, to the Prawn Noodle, Hokkien Mee and Cha Koay (black is best), the western food, chicken rice, thai and zichar … to the coffee …

Nothing is a weak link. Portions are generous at most of the stalls too. Eat everything !
